BasicDescription.Title: Weather View
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Detailed weather forecast.

BasicDescription.Title: Antiques Roadshow
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Leeds: Michael and the experts visit Leeds Town Hall, where they find a painting by an Australian war artist and a permit for carrying a cigarette lighter in Portugal. W/S. [Signed]

BasicDescription.Title: Watchdog
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The Watchdog team takes a stand on behalf of consumers, tackling your problems live on air, exposing high street scandals and conducting investigations. W/S. [Signed]

BasicDescription.Title: Panorama
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Bullied To Death? Ross McWilliam examines the deaths of four young soldiers at Deepcut Army barracks. The Army claims all four committed suicide, but the families are unconvinced. W/S. [Signed]

RelatedMaterial.PromotionalText:
For a guide to all the signed programmes being broadcast on
the BBC's television channels log on to:

BasicDescription.Title: Sahara With Michael Palin
BasicDescription.Synopsis: On the second leg of his journey, Michael Palin travels through Senegal and Mali to the Niger river. W/S. [Signed]

BasicDescription.Title: What The Stuarts Did For Us
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Desygner Livinge: Adam Hart-Davis examines innovations that appeared during the Stuarts' reign such as the three-piece suit, coffee shops, and the construction techniques of Sir Christopher Wren.

BasicDescription.Title: BBC News 24
BasicDescription.Synopsis: BBC ONE joins the BBC's rolling news channel for a night of news, with bulletins on the hour and the headlines every 15 minutes.

BasicDescription.Title: Breakfast
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Start your day with all the latest news, sport, business and weather from the BBC's Breakfast team. Includes regional news at 25 and 55 minutes past each hour.

RelatedMaterial.PromotionalText:
Web Link: Click on 'Today's Information' for contact addresses
and links to recent items that have featured on the show.

BasicDescription.Title: Kilroy
BasicDescription.Synopsis: His Affair Helped Our Marriage: Robert Kilroy-Silk talks to couples who found that their relationships were made stronger as a result of infidelity. Followed by BBC News and Weather.

BasicDescription.Title: Ruby
BasicDescription.Synopsis: A lively mix of celebrity chat, audience discussion and studio mayhem with Ruby Wax. Today she is joined by John Simpson and Michael Moore. W/S. Then News and Weather.

BasicDescription.Title: Big Strong Boys
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Newent Lounge: A revamped fireplace, eye-level storage and stripped floorboards are on the agenda, as Jake Robinson and Gavin Lowe use their DIY expertise to transform a lounge.

BasicDescription.Title: Trading Up
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Oldbury: Colin McAllister and Justin Ryan are in the West Midlands today where they track down and do up a home for local buyers. W/S. Followed by BBC News and Weather.

BasicDescription.Title: Cash In The Attic
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Farrier: Mary wants to spruce up her garden and get a modern garden shed. She calls in the team to help her go through her antiques collection in order to raise �2000 at auction.

BasicDescription.Title: Wipeout
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Bob Monkhouse hosts the humorous general knowledge quiz where if you know the subject it's easy but if you don't, wipeout awaits.

BasicDescription.Title: BBC News
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest national and international news from the BBC this lunchtime, including Weather.

BasicDescription.Title: BBC London News
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest stories from the BBC London newsroom.

BasicDescription.Title: Neighbours
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Susan and Libby start their course at university, and Toadie incorporates his bickering parents into his radio show. Meanwhile, the rift between Harold and Lou grows deeper.

BasicDescription.Title: Diagnosis Murder
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Too Many Cooks: A pleasure-loving French chef is murdered while recording a TV programme. Dr Sloane starts an investigation, but soon finds that the victim had more than one enemy.

BasicDescription.Title: As Time Goes By
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Judith endeavours to get Jean and Lionel to be closer, but her efforts make Jean feel decidedly uneasy.

BasicDescription.Title: Fimbles
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBeebies. Yellow: Pom finds a yellow circle in the Purple Meadow - it's lovely and warm to play in, and someone is especially happy to see the yellow - find out who it is!

BasicDescription.Title: Woody Woodpecker
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBBC. Fake Vacation/Medical Winnie Pig/Cable Ace: Woody goes on holiday, then Winnie wants to become a doctor, and finally Woody wants to watch the Highland Games.

BasicDescription.Title: Mona The Vampire
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBBC. The Spelling Bee: Mona is a ten year old girl who revels in the icky and eerie - when there's a ghoulish mystery to be solved she becomes Mona The Vampire.

BasicDescription.Title: The Story Of Tracy Beaker
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBBC. Tracy cheekily smuggles a mystery boy into the Dumping Ground and a game of cat and mouse begins.

BasicDescription.Title: The Wild Thornberrys
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBBC. Lost And Foundation: The girls discover that their parents have mistakenly taken embarrassing home movies to an awards ceremony - and vow to get them back.

BasicDescription.Title: SMart
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBBC. The art show packed with ideas to help you with your picture making.

BasicDescription.Title: CBBC At The Fame Academy
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBBC. Get the latest from the Fame Academy where the students compete to win the biggest prize money can't buy.

BasicDescription.Title: Newsround
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBBC. Daily news magazine keeping you up to date on the latest stories and events happening at home and abroad.

BasicDescription.Title: BBC News
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest national and international news from the BBC. Includes a weather summary.

BasicDescription.Title: BBC London News
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest stories from the BBC London newsroom. Followed by the national headlines and Weather.

BasicDescription.Title: Fame Academy
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The remaining students may have the talent, but have they got the stamina to survive the backstabbing and make it to the million pound record deal?

BasicDescription.Title: EastEnders
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Peggy forces Phil to face the community, Kat feels under pressure to find a date and Sonia promises Phil he's not going to get away with what he's done.

BasicDescription.Title: My Family
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Ghosts: A name from the past comes back to haunt Susan, who is determined to dampen her old flame, but not before Ben gets singed.

BasicDescription.Title: Ground Force
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The Italian Job: The Ground Force team head for Umbria in Italy, where they've been challenged to create a secret garden for the Anglican Vicar of Rome.

BasicDescription.Title: David Attenborough: A Life On Air
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Michael Palin visits his friend David Attenborough and, with the help of archive clips, recalls the people and animals Sir David has met and the places he's visited during his 50 year career.

Michael Palin visits his friend and fellow traveller Sir David Attenborough and, with the help of archive clips from his most famous series, recalls the people and animals Attenborough has met and the places he's visited during his 50 year career.
In 1954 he launched the first of his famous Zoo Quest series for the BBC, which took him to remote parts of the world over the next decade. His other programmes included political broadcasts, archaeological quizzes, short stories, gardening and religious programmes.
He was controller of BBC TWO in the mid 1960s and rose to become Director of Programmes in 1969. In 1973, he decided to follow his dream and returned to programme making. Series' such as Life On Earth followed in 1979, forming a trilogy with The Living Planet (1984) and The Trials of Life (1990).
1993 saw him travelling to Antarctica for Life in the Freezer and in 1995, he wrote and presented the The Private Life of Plants. He marked 40 years of the BBC Natural History Unit in 1997 with the award-winning The Wildlife Specials. In 1998, he completed the much loved BBC series, The Life of Birds.
State Of The Planet and The Blue Planet followed in 2000 and 2001 and he can currently be seen in his new BBC ONE series, the Life Of Mammals.
David Attenborough was knighted in 1985, has written several books and has received honorary degrees and a number of prestigious awards including Fellowship of the Royal Society.
BasicDescription.PromotionalInformation: BBC Book: Life on Air - David Attenborough Memoirs, Hardback.

BasicDescription.Title: BBC News At Ten O'Clock
BasicDescription.Synopsis: National and international news, with reports from BBC correspondents worldwide.

BasicDescription.Title: BBC London News
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest stories from the BBC London newsroom.

BasicDescription.Title: Question Time
BasicDescription.Synopsis: David Dimbleby invites a studio audience to put their questions to a panel of leading politicians and public figures.

BasicDescription.Title: Faith In Fashion
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Fashion and Islam aren't words that are often seen together. But a new generation of Muslim designers are breaking down stereotypes and bringing Islamic inspiration to the world of haute couture.
